answers.answer: Yep! Vision changes duringpregnancy and dizziness is common. But if it gets concerning talk to your doc!
Check with your doc.  Some sight issues can be related to high blood pressure.

I have TERRIBLE vision. I had great vision until my 20th week. Freaked me out and I went to the hospital cause my vision was terrible and I got so dizzy at night I couldn't fall asleep. My blood pressure was perfectly fine until the night time, when it actually dropped a bit. But doctors say that's normal at night for pregnant women. Don't be too paranoid, not all bad vision means high blood pressure or preeclampsia lol. But talk to your doc just to ease your mind.
I never wore glasses til I got pregnant with my daughter now I have to wear them permanently

question: I'm 31wks and it's starting to get a little difficult to see. It takes me about 4seconds to focus on words or the tv. I also get dizzy spells. Is that normal.
title: vision problems
